alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A gusty outflow boundary will impact portions of Nicholas, southeastern Kanawha, Raleigh, southern Webster, north central Wyoming, southeastern Clay, Fayette and southeastern Boone Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 922 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty outflow boundary from Naoma northeast to Boggs, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Ansted, Sophia, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Camden-On-gauley, Piney View, Coal City, Birch River, Prosperity and Burnwell. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 32 and 74. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 134. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
